result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlos J Perez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Carlos J Perez appeared by video.  Attorney Michael M. Hayes appeared by video for Carlos J Perez.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for pretrial conference. 
Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the state. Defense requests status date to determine case posture. 
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Carlos J Perez in court.  Attorney Michael M. Hayes in court for Carlos J Perez.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 15.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Carlos J Perez in court.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is scheduled for an Initial Appearance. Defense counsel is in another branch. Due to a conflict and commissioner's recusal, matter is adjourned. Case remains calendared in OCCR.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Carlos J Perez in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called on the record for Initial Appearance. Commissioner strikes record and recused. Case to be heard by a different court official. Case passed.

Adjustment Number: 22A 071210,
Payable Number: 1022496,
Receipt Number: 22RP030323,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/29/22 @ 1:30p
